title: Matthew Tan | Web Directory | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: Associate Professor Matthew Tan is a sustainability professional with over 20 years of experience in the Agri-Tech sector. His career has been marked by successful implementations and management of sustainability initiatives in the Aquaculture & Agriculture industries. Notably, he has played a pivotal role in assisting governments with their economic transformation through the adoption of Agri-Tech 4.0.As a Sustainability Specialist for the Agri & Food production industry, he has been instrumental in developing and implementing carbon neutral strategies that significantly reduce carbon footprints, contributing to a more environmentally conscious & sustainable future plus guiding organizations through the complex process of transitioning to carbon-neutral operations.His recent achievements include spearheading the integration of ESG principles into Agri related  projects, aligning business strategies with sustainable practices; development and executing carbon-neutral strategies whereby effectively reducing the environmental footprint of related Agri & food processing operations. His commitment to promoting sustainable practices is further demonstrated through the establishment of strategic partnerships with key stakeholders, including government bodies, NGOs, and industry leaders.He is also currently Singapore Representative (Private Sector) to APEC Policy Partnership on Food Security and is also the current APEC Chair for Sustainable Development in Agricultural and Fishery sectors (PPFS) where he co-ordinates discussions between senior officials, APEC governments and the private sector on the use of technology and combined resources for Sustainable Development in the Aquaculture, Agriculture and Fishery industry. For the past number of years, he has also been actively involved in assisting governments with their Economic Transformation – Agri Tech 4.0 in the light of food security; working in tandem with the various ministries and multiple stakeholders in the country with an overarching view to achieving their future food securities goals.In tandem with his current APEC appointment, A/Prof Tan is also serving as the Chief Executive Officer (Asia) of Assentoft Aqua Asia Pte Ltd. Assentoft Aqua A/S (Denmark) is one of the world's leading Aquaculture Engineering companies and the team at Assentoft Aqua has been involved in Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS) development since the very beginning of the recirculation aquaculture industry in 1978; thus, learning from both successes and failures from existing plants, including salmon plants. Assentoft is second to none in having the lowest possible footprint RAS that saves space, pipes, buildings etc, rapid installation time by using steel tanks as our basic component, having the best available water treatment within the industry, low investment per produced ton of fish and deep knowledge about salmon, trout and tropical pelagic fish production in land-based RAS-systems.Prior to his current corporate appointment, A/Prof Tan was previously the Group Chief Technology Officer & Chief Risk Officer of Oceanus Group Ltd and CEO & Director of Oceanus Tech Pte Ltd (a wholly owned subsidiary of Oceanus Group) – One of the world’s largest land-based aquaculture companies which is listed on the main board of the Singapore Stock Exchange (from 2013 to 2020).He was responsible for the development of Oceanus Group's Risk Management framework and farms' operational protocols manuals and oversaw the development and implementation of the company farm’s Bio-security plan which includes the validation & adoption of sustainable technologies, implementation of water monitoring system, animal nutrition & feed formulation and possible use of Recirculating Aquaculture technologies in their land-based farms (total 42 farms spread over 300 km of coastal areas and a 5,000 floating sea cage farm).He was also part of the new management team that spearheaded the restructuring of the company in 2015 and was instrumental in proposing the major changes to their business model and restructuring of operations which saw a 60% reduction in overheads and expenses subsequently. The restructuring efforts paid off and the company turned profitable in 2020. Note that the company was saddled with huge debts and defaulted on a totalling debt of S$94 million in 2014 and had a negative net asset position of approximately S$66 million.Subsequently, he was seconded and promoted to CEO & Director of Oceanus Tech Pte Ltd which was setup by the group to spearhead the group expansion.He is also a graduate from SEAFDEC (Southeast Asian Fisheries Development Centre) – Asia’s leading fishery institution; where he received a Training Fellowship under a Government of Japan – Trust Fund Programme in hatchery and grow-out, seaweed and Benthic Diatom culture and production.On the academic frontier, Matthew serves as an Adjunct Professor with domain expertise in applied sustainability practices and protocols for the Agri & Food Industry. Beyond his hands-on contributions, he shares his insights as a lecturer cum instructor in Deep Tech Translation and Master’s degree programmes; with key focus in ESG, Sustainability, and Carbon-Neutral Engineering. His engaging teaching style, coupled with real-world examples, not only makes complex concepts accessible but also inspires students to be catalysts for positive change in their respective fields.He was also previously serving as an Adjunct Senior Research Fellow and Associate Professor (Aquaculture) with the Centre for Sustainable Tropical Fisheries and Aquaculture (CSTFA) - College of Science and Engineering - James Cook University, Australia.James Cook University specializes in the sustainable exploitation of tropical aquatic species and is Australia’s leading university in Tropical Fisheries Science. Through the Centre for Sustainable Tropical Fisheries and Aquaculture (CSTFA), JCU partners with industry, NGOs, and government to tackle grand challenges associated with sustainable production of seafood. Current external appointments:1. Singapore Representative (Private Sector): Policy Partnership on Food Security, Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC). About APEC PPFS : https://apec.org/Groups/Other-Groups/Policy-Partnership-on-Food-Security.aspx2. Chair - Sustainable Development for the Agriculture and Fisheries Sector, APEC PPFS. Responsible for coordination of discussions between APEC governments and the private sector on the use of technology and combined resources for Sustainable Development of Aquaculture, Agriculture and Fishery Sectors within the APEC region and set-up of APEC Centre for Sustainable Development in Agriculture and Fisheries sectors in Singapore.3. Member – Advisory Board : PT. Terra Baru Indonesia – Indonesia's Leading Biochar and Carbon Credit Specialists : TerraBaru drives sustainable innovation by transforming waste into valuable capital, powering a net-zero future and delivering measurable impact across the planet, society, and the economy. TerraBaru is a seasoned team of global executives united by a single mission— to address Indonesia’s 250 million tons per year agricultural waste problem. With a diverse background encompassing expertise in resource development, sustainable practices, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation, environmental law, and investment banking, TerraBaru is uniquely positioned to create transformative solutions.  By impacting communities, soil, air, and water, and transforming waste and emissions into capital, we build a world where carbon emissions and soil degradation become valuable resources to fund environmental and social sustainability. https://terrabaru.com/4. Member – Scientific Advisory Board : Sento Biotech Sdn Bhd – Development of Carbon Neutral feed for culture of Macrobrachium rosenbergii, also known as the giant river prawn or giant freshwater prawn.5. Advisor (HON) - Centre for Aquaculture and Veterinary Science, School of Applied Science, Temasek Polytechnic. 6.  Member - Investment Committee - Asia Food Sustainability Fund. This Venture fund targets startups in the Deep-tech, Agri-tech, Food Sustainability and Consumer Packaged Goods industry. It is committed to support agri-food tech startups around the world that are committed to creating a sustainable and healthier future for everyone. The Asia Food Sustainability Fund is dedicated to backing early-stage companies that are leveraging the vast potential for growth in the agri-food tech industry in Asia. This fund leverage on Innovate 360’s ecosystem, which includes infrastructure, accelerator, strategic partnerships and networks in which deep tech startups are well positioned to grow exponentially and create positive impact to the world.  About Innovate 360 - https://innovate360.sg/about/7. Member – Editorial Board : Journal of Marine Biology and Aquatic Research (JMBAR)8. Member – Editorial Board : Aquatic Research Journal Track Records and Completed Projects- Principal Consultant/ Chief Sustainability & Technology Officer Designate – On site survey and measurement for carbon sequestration potential, carbon credit development and mangrove aquaculture CSR in Indonesia for Singapore/ Indonesia entity. This project involves Mangrove, peatland & coastal restoration plus possible CSR planning for regenerative Aquaculture for the indigenous people. June 2022 to 2024- Member - Scientific Advisory Board cum Chief Sustainability Officer - Carbon Neutral Prawn Project – An APEC reference project – Singapore & Malaysia. A carbon-neutral prawn aquaculture system through the development of sustainable aquafeed and the adoption of a green circular economy. The fruition of this project will create a massive disruption to the aquaculture & feed industry as it will create a sustainable aquaculture industry that minimizes its environmental impact while providing high-quality and carbon neutral seafood to consumers. Dec 2022 to present.- Advisor (Sustainability) - Frederiksdal Pte Ltd. Frederiksdal is one of the world’s largest cherry vineyards (Denmark) and also the only one in the world that produces wine from cherries according to the same principles that have been used in centuries of production of grape wine. Providence of net zero and carbon neutral advisory and recommendations for the implementation of carbon mitigation strategies and re-evaluation of the wine Life Cycle Analysis re. carbon neutrality – July 23 to present.- Member of Advisory Board – One of the world’s leading cell-based cultured seafood company that utilizes tissue formation methods to produce healthy and tasty seafood meat. June 23 to present. - Member - Technical Advisory Panel (Agri Tech) - Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE) : Agency for Science, Technology & Research (A*STAR). 2022 to 2024- Principal Consultant – Agritech feasibility study and development of a Strategic White Paper for a main board listed company in Singapore. This listco is looking to diversify and enter the Agri Industry. Oct 2020.- Senior Principal Consultant  & Head of Technical Team  – Part of the economic advisory team that put together the Strategic Aquaculture Redevelopment Plan for the Government of Western Africa. This project includes 53 site surveys completed and the identification and development of 16 sites as Special Economic Zone for self-sustainable aquaculture.  2018 – 2020.Chairman - Scientific Advisory Board – Singapore Crawfish (Singapore, Malaysia and Indonesia). Specialized in the production of genetically improved SPF (Specific Pathogen Free) Cherax Quadricarinatus with SPF and SPR family lines originating from Australia, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand and Singapore. This company pioneers modern vertical aquaculture system and it boasts an R&D and engineering team that has the capability to install and fabricate customized systems for crawfish breeding and cultivation - 2021 to August 2024- Chairman – Scientific Advisory Board - SEA Aquaculture. Development of a vertically integrated 10,000 Metric Ton production per year Atlantic Salmon RAS facility in Vietnam. This is a key food security project in Asia – An APEC Project. Total project value US$100m – 10 HA footprint.- Member - Scientific Advisory Board - Pebble Labs, Inc : A USA based biotechnology company developing solutions to safely and sustainably increase aquaculture yield and food security. Its mission is to develop breakthrough disruptive technologies that address the greatest agriculture, aquaculture, and environmental challenges facing the globe. Pebble Labs is committed to urgently solving these challenges. - Member - Peer Review Group : Global Livestock and Aquaculture Policy Project - Funded by Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation (BMGF) - CHATHAM HOUSE - The Royal Institute of International Affairs. From 2019 to 2020.- Principal Consultant – Development of the proposal for the introduction of intensive & indoor shrimp farming system and redevelopment of 2,000 acres of land for Aquaculture in Rompin, Malaysia.  2019 to 2022.- Principal Consultant – Assessment of the Vanuatu Aquaculture Industry – Development of the re-development  proposal for the Trade commissioner of Vanuatu – 2018- Principal Consultant – Assessment the conversion of 8,000 disused shrimp (post disease outbreak)  pond into Barramundi Culture – Sri Lanka- Principal Consultant : AVA Land tender specification – 1.3 HA and proposal development for a bio secure hatchery for a leading aquaculture player in Singapore. Awarded land lease in 2019.- Principal Consultant : Strategy development and implementation for the largest fishery feed player in Nigeria. Was involved in the implementation of the plans which include training of farmers cooperatives (aquaculture) and a team of technical executives responsible for subsequent follow-up with these farmers for the whole of Nigeria - 2017 to 2020.- Principal Consultant : Design of 2.3 HA Bio-secure aquaculture facility which include hatchery, nursery, grow-out and brood stock holding areas in Africa - 2017 to 2020.- Principal Consultant : Technical advisory to Aquaculture farmers in Egypt & Ghana for the largest fishery feed mill in Africa- 2017 to 2020.- Principal Consultant : Design and set-up of 2.3-hectare Bio-secure aquaculture facility (about US$3m) which include hatchery, nursery and brood stock holding areas in Malaysia – 2017.- Principal Consultant : Site survey - 220 Acres of disused shrimps’ raceways and land for possible aquaculture grow-out use. West Malaysia 2016.- Principal Consultant : Hybrid Grouper species development and ECO diversity study on endemic species– Malaysia – 2016- Collaborator : Bio marker study on Abalone laggard and Selective Genetics breeding - Jointly with Temasek Poly & Oceanus Group – 2017.- Collaborator & Technology Partner : Use of Hydrocavitation technology for increasing aquaculture harvest yield - Jointly with one of the world's largest shrimps’ producers – 2015 to 2017- Principal Consultant : Design and Setup of 2 HA Bio Secure Grouper/ Sea Bass Hatchery and Aquaculture farm – Malaysia – 2016- Principal Investigator : Design and use of hydrocavitation technology for Sea Bass and shrimps pond culture in Sri Lanka.- Principal Consultant : Design of Inland bio secure Hatchery facility (1.2 HA) in Ipoh, Malaysia.- Principal Investigator : Investigation on possible conversion of existing shrimp culture ponds (500 HA) for food fish grow-out in Pahang, Malaysia.- Principal Investigator – Investigation and technical Advisory on the mortalities and grow-out issues in a State-owned Tilapia farm. Indonesia.- Principal Investigator : MND Research Fund Grant on “Ecological Land Based Aquaculture - Farming of food fish in Urban environment”. Multi-million-dollar MND grant to fully develop a high intensity & high yield aquaculture RAS farming system using minimum space and labour through the integration of people, technology and business system.- Co-Principal Investigator (with Surbana Technologies) : Development of Multiple storey land-based food-fish breeding system with Surbana Technologies. This project leverage off high intensity vertical fish farming as an "engineering" solution to solve this issue.- Project Director : Development of a Fully automated and online monitoring of water conditions for aquaculture farms – Horiba Instruments & Bio X Pte Ltd- Principal Investigator - Development of live support system for shipping containers for the shipping of live sea food (sea to land) with APL (part of NOL Shipping Group) one of the world’s top shipping companies. The project successfully research, designed and developed an enclosed automated recirculation water filtration and treatment system for incorporation into APL’s Live reefer container.- Project Director – 2013 Technical farm audit completed for the world’s largest Aquaculture (China) spanning more than 300 km. Oceanus Group.- Principal Investigator and project Director – Development and setup of Asia first Aquahub (live seafood holding logistic hub) in Jurong Cold Hub One, Singapore. A joint development with CWT Fresh (Part of CWT Group)

Biography
Associate Professor Matthew Tan

is a sustainability professional with over 20 years of experience in the Agri-Tech sector. His career has been marked by successful implementations and management of sustainability initiatives in the Aquaculture & Agriculture industries. Notably, he has played a pivotal role in assisting governments with their economic transformation through the adoption of Agri-Tech 4.0.

As a Sustainability Specialist for the Agri & Food production industry, he has been instrumental in developing and implementing carbon neutral strategies that significantly reduce carbon footprints, contributing to a more environmentally conscious & sustainable future plus guiding organizations through the complex process of transitioning to carbon-neutral operations.

His recent achievements include spearheading the integration of ESG principles into Agri related  projects, aligning business strategies with sustainable practices; development and executing carbon-neutral strategies whereby effectively reducing the environmental footprint of related Agri & food processing operations. His commitment to promoting sustainable practices is further demonstrated through the establishment of strategic partnerships with key stakeholders, including government bodies, NGOs, and industry leaders.

He is also currently Singapore Representative (Private Sector) to APEC Policy Partnership on Food Security and is also the current APEC Chair for Sustainable Development in Agricultural and Fishery sectors (PPFS) where he co-ordinates discussions between senior officials, APEC governments and the private sector on the use of technology and combined resources for Sustainable Development in the Aquaculture, Agriculture and Fishery industry. For the past number of years, he has also been actively involved in assisting governments with their Economic Transformation – Agri Tech 4.0 in the light of food security; working in tandem with the various ministries and multiple stakeholders in the country with an overarching view to achieving their future food securities goals.

In tandem with his current APEC appointment, A/Prof Tan is also serving as the Chief Executive Officer (Asia) of Assentoft Aqua Asia Pte Ltd. Assentoft Aqua A/S (Denmark) is one of the world's leading Aquaculture Engineering companies and the team at Assentoft Aqua has been involved in Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS) development since the very beginning of the recirculation aquaculture industry in 1978; thus, learning from both successes and failures from existing plants, including salmon plants. Assentoft is second to none in having the lowest possible footprint RAS that saves space, pipes, buildings etc, rapid installation time by using steel tanks as our basic component, having the best available water treatment within the industry, low investment per produced ton of fish and deep knowledge about salmon, trout and tropical pelagic fish production in land-based RAS-systems.

Prior to his current corporate appointment, A/Prof Tan was previously the Group Chief Technology Officer & Chief Risk Officer of Oceanus Group Ltd and CEO & Director of Oceanus Tech Pte Ltd (a wholly owned subsidiary of Oceanus Group) – One of the world’s largest land-based aquaculture companies which is listed on the main board of the Singapore Stock Exchange (from 2013 to 2020).

He was responsible for the development of Oceanus Group's Risk Management framework and farms' operational protocols manuals and oversaw the development and implementation of the company farm’s Bio-security plan which includes the validation & adoption of sustainable technologies, implementation of water monitoring system, animal nutrition & feed formulation and possible use of Recirculating Aquaculture technologies in their land-based farms (total 42 farms spread over 300 km of coastal areas and a 5,000 floating sea cage farm).

He was also part of the new management team that spearheaded the restructuring of the company in 2015 and was instrumental in proposing the major changes to their business model and restructuring of operations which saw a 60% reduction in overheads and expenses subsequently. The restructuring efforts paid off and the company turned profitable in 2020. Note that the company was saddled with huge debts and defaulted on a totalling debt of S$94 million in 2014 and had a negative net asset position of approximately S$66 million.
Subsequently, he was seconded and promoted to CEO & Director of Oceanus Tech Pte Ltd which was setup by the group to spearhead the group expansion.

He is also a graduate from SEAFDEC (Southeast Asian Fisheries Development Centre) – Asia’s leading fishery institution; where he received a Training Fellowship under a Government of Japan – Trust Fund Programme in hatchery and grow-out, seaweed and Benthic Diatom culture and production.

On the academic frontier, Matthew serves as an Adjunct Professor with domain expertise in applied sustainability practices and protocols for the Agri & Food Industry. Beyond his hands-on contributions, he shares his insights as a lecturer cum instructor in Deep Tech Translation and Master’s degree programmes; with key focus in ESG, Sustainability, and Carbon-Neutral Engineering. His engaging teaching style, coupled with real-world examples, not only makes complex concepts accessible but also inspires students to be catalysts for positive change in their respective fields.

He was also previously serving as an Adjunct Senior Research Fellow and Associate Professor (Aquaculture) with the Centre for Sustainable Tropical Fisheries and Aquaculture (CSTFA) - College of Science and Engineering - James Cook University, Australia.

James Cook University specializes in the sustainable exploitation of tropical aquatic species and is Australia’s leading university in Tropical Fisheries Science. Through the Centre for Sustainable Tropical Fisheries and Aquaculture (CSTFA), JCU partners with industry, NGOs, and government to tackle grand challenges associated with sustainable production of seafood.
Current external appointments:
1. Singapore Representative (Private Sector):
Policy Partnership on Food Security, Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC). About APEC PPFS :
https://apec.org/Groups/Other-Groups/Policy-Partnership-on-Food-Security.aspx
2. Chair - Sustainable Development for the Agriculture and Fisheries Sector, APEC PPFS.

Responsible for coordination of discussions between APEC governments and the private sector on the use of technology and combined resources for Sustainable Development of Aquaculture, Agriculture and Fishery Sectors within the APEC region and set-up of APEC Centre for Sustainable Development in Agriculture and Fisheries sectors in Singapore.
3. Member – Advisory Board
PT. Terra Baru Indonesia
Indonesia's Leading Biochar and Carbon Credit Specialists :

TerraBaru drives sustainable innovation by transforming waste into valuable capital, powering a net-zero future and delivering measurable impact across the planet, society, and the economy. TerraBaru is a seasoned team of global executives united by a single mission— to address Indonesia’s 250 million tons per year agricultural waste problem. With a diverse background encompassing expertise in resource development, sustainable practices, ecosystem and biodiversity conservation, environmental law, and investment banking, TerraBaru is uniquely positioned to create transformative solutions.  By impacting communities, soil, air, and water, and transforming waste and emissions into capital, we build a world where carbon emissions and soil degradation become valuable resources to fund environmental and social sustainability.
https://terrabaru.com/
4. Member – Scientific Advisory Board
: Sento Biotech Sdn Bhd – Development of Carbon Neutral feed for culture of Macrobrachium rosenbergii, also known as the giant river prawn or giant freshwater prawn.
5. Advisor (HON)
- Centre for Aquaculture and Veterinary Science, School of Applied Science, Temasek Polytechnic.
6.  Member - Investment Committee

- Asia Food Sustainability Fund. This Venture fund targets startups in the Deep-tech, Agri-tech, Food Sustainability and Consumer Packaged Goods industry. It is committed to support agri-food tech startups around the world that are committed to creating a sustainable and healthier future for everyone. The Asia Food Sustainability Fund is dedicated to backing early-stage companies that are leveraging the vast potential for growth in the agri-food tech industry in Asia. This fund leverage on Innovate 360’s ecosystem, which includes infrastructure, accelerator, strategic partnerships and networks in which deep tech startups are well positioned to grow exponentially and create positive impact to the world.
About Innovate 360 - https://innovate360.sg/about/
7. Member – Editorial Board
: Journal of Marine Biology and Aquatic Research (JMBAR)
8. Member – Editorial Board
: Aquatic Research Journal

This project involves Mangrove, peatland & coastal restoration plus possible CSR planning for regenerative Aquaculture for the indigenous people. June 2022 to 2024

A carbon-neutral prawn aquaculture system through the development of sustainable aquafeed and the adoption of a green circular economy. The fruition of this project will create a massive disruption to the aquaculture & feed industry as it will create a sustainable aquaculture industry that minimizes its environmental impact while providing high-quality and carbon neutral seafood to consumers. Frederiksdal is one of the world’s largest cherry vineyards (Denmark) and also the only one in the world that produces wine from cherries according to the same principles that have been used in centuries of production of grape wine. Pebble Labs is committed to urgently solving these challenges.

Research
Current Projects
Enhancement of Existing Life support system (RAS) for Large Scale Crustacean Hatchery in Asia.
Present
Enhancement to existing life support system for Large Scale Crustacean Hatchery  - Use of Passive Hydrocavitation support.
Carbon Credit Developer for the Aquaculture Industry
Present

Member – Advisory Board - PT Terra Baru Indonesia -  PT Terra Baru  – Carbon Credit Specialist. Planet NetZero is built from the need to develop large-scale, impactful, and measurable solutions to increase food security and fight climate change. PNZ delivers profitable, internationally funded projects to reduce carbon emissions and plastic waste, protect the environment and biodiversity, and drive social development. From 2022 to present.
Carbon Neutral Wine Production
Present

Advisor (Sustainability) : Frederiksdal is one of the world’s largest cherry vineyards (Denmark) and also the only one in the world that produces wine from cherries according to the same principles that have been used in centuries of production of grape wine. Present

High Tech Rainbow Trout Farm in Asia
Present

The Project looks to develop Asia's first high-tech fish farm for producing 2,110 tonnes of trout, to cater to local demand for fresh, sustainable, premium fish. The project showcases the proprietary ModulRAS system developed by Assentoft Aqua, a Danish technological partner specialising in sustainable land-based RAS aquaculture technologies. The intended project will incorporate super-intensive technology coupled with AI to help achieve sustainable fish production locally to support Asia's food security initiatives, by making available fresh daily harvest of its premium quality trout.
Valorization of food  processing  waste-streams  into  functional  ingredients and/materials for sustainable functional food and animal feed development.
Present
Advisor (Sustainability) - Valorization of food  processing  waste-streams  into  functional  ingredients and/materials for sustainable functional food and animal feed development.
Mangrove, peatland & coastal restoration
Present

Principal Consultant/ Chief Sustainability & Technology Officer Designate – On site survey and measurement for carbon sequestration potential, carbon credit development and mangrove aquaculture CSR in Indonesia for Singapore/ Indonesia entity. This project involves Mangrove, peatland & coastal restoration plus possible CSR planning for regenerative Aquaculture for the indigenous people. June 2022 to present.
Principal Consultant – Development of a strategic plan which include the filing of proprietary Aquaculture IP and farm management manual for a leading crustacean Hatchery in Asia – 2021.
Present
Carbon Neutral Prawn Project
Present

Member - Scientific Advisory Board cum Chief Sustainability Officer - Carbon Neutral Prawn Project – An APEC reference project – Singapore & Malaysia. A carbon-neutral prawn aquaculture system through the development of sustainable aquafeed and the adoption of a green circular economy. The fruition of this project will create a massive disruption to the aquaculture & feed industry as it will create a sustainable aquaculture industry that minimizes its environmental impact while providing high-quality and carbon neutral seafood to consumers. Dec 2022 to present.
Past Projects

Principal Consultant – Aquaculture & Agri related feasibility study and development of a Strategic White Paper for a main board listed company in Singapore. This listco is looking to enter the Agri & Food Industry. Oct 2020.

Member - Peer Review Group : Global Livestock and Aquaculture Policy Project - Funded by Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation (BMGF) - CHATHAM HOUSE - The Royal Institute of International Affairs. From 2019 to 2020.
Member - Scientific Advisory Board - Pebble Labs, Inc :A USA based biotechnology company developing solutions to safely and sustainably increase natural crop yield and food security.
Co-Principal Investigator : Development of sustained micro nutrient/ amino acid delivery system for fish feed  - Awarded AVA Food sustainability grant - Jointly with NTU.
Principal Consultant - Development of Chemical Free instant disinfection process for freshly cut vegetables for one of Asia's largest indoor multi storey plant factory
Principal Investigator : Development of an Accelerated Seedling germination process and vegetable growth acceleration process for an Urban farming facility in Singapore.
Principal Consultant : Assessment of the Nigerian fishery & Aquaculture industry and design and Development of a 2 hectare High Tech Aquaculture facility in Africa.
Principal Consultant : Assessment of the Egypt fishery and aquaculture market and made recommendations for client strategic entry into the Egyptian market.
Collaborator : Bio marker study on Abalone laggards and Selective Genetics breeding - Jointly with Temasek Poly & Oceanus Group
Principal Consultant : Land Based Aquaponics farm that is powered entirely by Solar Energy (Singapore & Malaysia) - An APEC project

Principal Consultant : Design and setup of Hatchery, nursery and brood stock holding facility in Kelantan, Malaysia, hybrid Grouper species development and assessment on the possible takeover of a disused shrimp island facility in Kota Bahru. Malaysia.
Principal Investigator : Development of anti-thermal coating, film for use in Aquaculture – Jointly with Nanyang Technological University
Principal Consultant: Assessment on the takeover of 500 disused shrimp’s raceway for Aquaculture use in Pahang, Malaysia.
Principal Consultant: Assessment on the use of disused shrimp’s ponds in Sri Lanka for Sea Bass breeding and the use of chemical free water treatment processes for such large pond.
Principal Consultant: Design and development of Sea Bass hatchery facility in Ipoh, Malaysia.
Principal Consultant : Design and Setup of Bio Secure Grouper/ Sea Bass Hatchery and Aquaculture farm - Malaysia

Principal Investigator: River Bio Remediation Project (Sungei Peng Siang). Joint project with PUB to develop a chemical free treatment process to treat and clean Sungei Peng Siang River (behind Warren Golf and Country club).
This river suffers from regular massive algae bloom which leads to unbearable stench for members of the public.

Principal Investigator and project Director – Development and setup of Asia first Aqua Hub (live seafood holding logistic hub) in Jurong Cold Hub One, Singapore. A joint development with CWT Fresh (Part of CWT Group).
Principal Consultant: Supply of Genetically selected sea bass fingerling to major aquaculture group in Thailand
Project Director : Technical farm audit completed for the world’s largest Abalone farm (China) spanning more than 300 km

Principal Investigator : Development of live support system for shipping containers for the shipping of live sea food (sea to land) with APL (part of NOL Shipping Group) one of the world’s top shipping company.
The project successfully research, designed and developed an enclosed automated recirculation water filtration and treatment system for incorporation into APL’s live reefer container.
Project Director : Development of a Fully automated and online monitoring of water conditions for aquaculture farms – Horiba Instruments & Bio X Pte Ltd
Collaborator & Technology Partner : Use of Hydrocavitation technology for increasing White Shrimps harvest yield in Indonesia- Jointly with one of the world’s largest shrimps producer
Principal Investigator: MND Research Fund Grant on “Ecological Land Based Aquaculture - Farming of food fish in urban environment”

Multi-million dollar MND grant awarded to fully develop a high intensity & high yield aquaculture farming system using minimum space and labour through the integration of people, technology and business system.
Co-Principal Investigator (with Surbana Technologies): Development of Multiple storey land based food-fish breeding system with Surbana Technologies
This project leverage off high intensity vertical fish farming as an "engineering" solution to solve this issue.
Principal Consultant : Design of chemical free water treatment processes (disinfection and oxygenation) for one of Singapore largest Koi hatchery

Enhancement to existing life support system for Large Scale Crustacean Hatchery  - Use of Passive Hydrocavitation support.

Member – Advisory Board - PT Terra Baru Indonesia -  PT Terra Baru  – Carbon Credit Specialist. Planet NetZero is built from the need to develop large-scale, impactful, and measurable solutions to increase food security and fight climate change. PNZ delivers profitable, internationally funded projects to reduce carbon emissions and plastic waste, protect the environment and biodiversity, and drive social development. From 2022 to present.

Advisor (Sustainability) : Frederiksdal is one of the world’s largest cherry vineyards (Denmark) and also the only one in the world that produces wine from cherries according to the same principles that have been used in centuries of production of grape wine. Providence of net zero and carbon neutral advisory and recommendations for the implementation of carbon mitigation strategies and re-evaluation of the wine Life Cycle Analysis re. carbon neutrality – July 23 to present.

Member - Advisory Board : One of the world’s leading cell-based cultured seafood company that utilizes tissue formation methods to produce healthy and tasty seafood meat plus advisory on their launch in Asia.

The Project looks to develop Asia's first high-tech fish farm for producing 2,110 tonnes of trout, to cater to local demand for fresh, sustainable, premium fish. The project showcases the proprietary ModulRAS system developed by Assentoft Aqua, a Danish technological partner specialising in sustainable land-based RAS aquaculture technologies. The intended project will incorporate super-intensive technology coupled with AI to help achieve sustainable fish production locally to support Asia's food security initiatives, by making available fresh daily harvest of its premium quality trout.
Advisor (Sustainability) - Valorization of food  processing  waste-streams  into  functional  ingredients and/materials for sustainable functional food and animal feed development.

Principal Consultant/ Chief Sustainability & Technology Officer Designate – On site survey and measurement for carbon sequestration potential, carbon credit development and mangrove aquaculture CSR in Indonesia for Singapore/ Indonesia entity. This project involves Mangrove, peatland & coastal restoration plus possible CSR planning for regenerative Aquaculture for the indigenous people. June 2022 to present.

Member - Scientific Advisory Board cum Chief Sustainability Officer - Carbon Neutral Prawn Project – An APEC reference project – Singapore & Malaysia. A carbon-neutral prawn aquaculture system through the development of sustainable aquafeed and the adoption of a green circular economy. The fruition of this project will create a massive disruption to the aquaculture & feed industry as it will create a sustainable aquaculture industry that minimizes its environmental impact while providing high-quality and carbon neutral seafood to consumers. Dec 2022 to present.
